page.title: 15Pubs and clubs
page.content: The Britsh Legion is right in the village centre. In the 1930's a village hall was built by the Walker family of Bod-Hyfryd.Later it was changed into a cafe owned by the Reid family.In 1981 it was turned into the British Legion.In 1983 an extension was built. The Valentine pub is in the old village near the Church.It is now owned by Mr.Kerr and his wife.They have been there one year.The Valentine has recently received a hygiene certificate.The pub was built in 1872 which makes it the oldest pub in Llanddulas. The Fair View is another pub which has recently changed hands.Built in 1890,it has a barbecue play area and activites for adults.Like other pubs, it runs teams for all the family, darts,pool and netball.
